summaries.body: Some people were upset that ads for “underwear for women with periods” might be kept from New York's subways. But the ads will be approved, a spokesman said.

display_asset.caption: People attended a rally on Thursday in West Palm Beach, Fla., for Corey Jones, who was shot and killed by a plainclothes police officer on Sunday.

summaries.body: Lawyers and the family of Corey Jones, a Florida drummer who was shot by a plainclothes police officer on Sunday, offered some of the first details of the fatal encounter.

display_asset.caption: A study raised new questions about the safety of voice-activated technology in many new cars.

summaries.body: When driving, don’t talk to your car or your phone. That’s the underlying message of a study that raises questions about the safety of voice-activated technology in many cars.

display_asset.caption: Raf Simons after his spring show earlier this month.

summaries.body: Christian Dior, the Parisian couture house, announced that the artistic director Raf Simons was leaving the brand. No replacement has been named.
Airbnb is removing a series of ads in San Francisco that highlight how much its guests and hosts contribute in taxes, saying they struck "the wrong tone."
Laverne Cox, a star of “Orange Is the New Black,” has signed on to Fox’s new production of “The Rocky Horror Picture Show.”

California's Republican congressmen will send a letter to President Obama and Gov. Jerry Brown on Thursday demanding a plan to store El Niño's deluge this winter. Above, a street in Burbank during the 1998 El Niño.

display_asset.caption: President Robert Mugabe of Zimbabwe, center, at the African Union headquarters in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, in January.

summaries.body: President Robert Mugabe of Zimbabwe, considered one of the world's most uncompromising dictators, was awarded a Confucius Peace Prize, China's answer to the Nobel Peace Prize.

display_asset.caption: In an image from a Reuters video, an empty red pickup truck was seen parked on the side of the road as police searched the area.

summaries.body: An anonymous tip led to the arrest and confession of a suspect in the fatal shooting of a 4-year-old girl after a road-rage encounter on an Albuquerque freeway.

display_asset.caption: Albanian migrants in front of an asylum center in Bamberg, Germany. The country has warned of an increase in attacks on shelters.
display_asset.credit: Laetitia Vancon for The New York Times

summaries.body: The police in Germany arrested three suspected right-wing extremists on Thursday after intercepting a package of detonators as warnings of violence against refugees rose.

display_asset.caption: Julie Bishop, Australian foreign minister and emoji enthusiast.

summaries.body: Emojis sent by Australia's foreign minister became a topic of debate in the Australian Senate on Thursday.

display_asset.credit: Bjorn Larsson Rosvall/TT News Agency, via Reuters

summaries.body: Four people were wounded and one was killed after they were attacked by a masked man with a sword or large knife at a school in Sweden, according to the police.
A Scottish nurse who survived Ebola only to fall critically ill some nine months later with meningitis is starting to recover, doctors said.
The pastor of a Singapore megachurch was convicted of fraud, with a judge finding that he had used millions in church funds to promote his wife’s career in pop music.

display_asset.caption: Jay Z performing Tuesday during Tidal X: 10/20, a benefit for the New World Foundation, at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn.
display_asset.credit: Chad Batka for The New York Times

summaries.body: A judge ruled that Jay Z and his producer, Timbaland, will not face a copyright infringement claim over the hit single “Big Pimpin’,” ending a complex eight-year lawsuit.

display_asset.caption: Zainab al-Khawaja, a leading opposition activist in Bahrain, outside a court in the capital, Manama, in 2014.

summaries.body: An opposition activist in Bahrain was sentenced to a year in prison for insulting the king by tearing up a photo of him in front of a judge while on trial for the very same act.

display_asset.caption: A knee replacement surgery in France. The procedure was more effective at relieving pain and improving function for patients with osteoarthritis than nonsurgical therapy alone, a study found.

summaries.body: Knee replacement surgery relieves pain and improves function in patients with severe osteoarthritis much more effectively than nonsurgical therapy alone, researchers said.
The Obama administration is preparing to sell eight new F-16 fighter jets to Pakistan, senior American officials said, an overture intended to bolster a tenuous partnership.

A Florida police officer who shot and killed a stranded driver Sunday apparently failed to disclose that he had been reprimanded at his last police job for neglecting to turn over morphine recovered from a suspect, records show.
The British and Chinese governments agreed to give China a substantial stake in the British nuclear industry, both as an investor and as a contractor.

display_asset.caption: President Obama listened to Carey Dixon's account of a loved one's struggle with substance abuse during a panel discussion Wednesday at the East End Family Resource Center in Charleston, W.Va.

summaries.body: President Obama traveled to Charleston, W.Va., where he announced modest steps to combat the opioid epidemic.

display_asset.caption: Ryquell Armstead sprinted in for a touchdown in Temple's win over Tulane earlier this month.

summaries.body: Ranked in the Associated Press poll for the first time since 1979 and 6-0 for the first time in 41 years, a confident Temple football team is asking: "What's next?"
The Department of Veterans Affairs refused to let five officials testify before a House committee, further straining a tense relationship with Congress.

display_asset.caption: Protesters at a demonstration on Monday by Pegida, the anti-foreigner group that emerged a year ago, in front of the Cathedral of the Holy Trinity, left, in Dresden, Germany.

summaries.body: The stabbing of a politician and a veiled call to reopen concentration camps at a rally of 20,000 people have set off new fears that anti-immigrant sentiment is taking a sharper turn in Germany.

display_asset.caption: A new species of tortoise was identified on Santa Cruz, in the center of the Galápagos Islands.

summaries.body: For the first time in more than a century, scientists have identified a new species of Galápagos tortoise, the grand giants of the Pacific archipelago that helped inspire Darwin’s theory of evolution.

display_asset.caption: The Hendo Hoverboard uses magnetic field architecture technology along with a copper surface to create the effect of levitation at the Hendo Hover office in Los Gatos, Calif., last year.
display_asset.credit: Jason Henry for The New York Times

summaries.body: "Back to the Future" promised us hoverboards. But the movie that planted the dream might also be to blame for the lack of a futuristic and really fun transportation device.
Children who regularly use antibiotics gain weight faster than those who have never taken the drugs, according to new research.

display_asset.caption: PewDiePie is a Swedish YouTube star whose real name is Felix Kjellberg.

summaries.body: YouTube and its parent company, Google, are hoping users will be willing to pay to watch videos without ads. It also announced YouTube Originals, a slate of programming.

display_asset.caption: Carl Icahn, center, at an event in New York last month.
display_asset.credit: Stephen Yang for The New York Times

summaries.body: Carl Icahn, the billionaire businessman supporting Donald J. Trump for president, is starting a “super PAC” with an “initial commitment of $150 million” that will focus on corporate tax reform.

display_asset.caption: South African students tried to force their way through the gates of Parliament on Wednesday during clashes with the police in Cape Town.

summaries.body: Riot police clashed with students protesting tuition increases in Cape Town, in the latest in a series of student demonstrations that have gripped South Africa.
